title: 9News Sydney | Monday November 24 | Full Episode
description: Peter Overton leads the Sydney news, covering a range of intense breaking and developing stories. The top local story is the fatal stabbing of a teenage boy in Rouse Hill, which led to a massive police operation. Nationally, the political arena was dominated by Pauline Hanson's controversial burqa stunt in the Senate, sparking fierce debate. The bulletin also features harrowing footage from the inquest into the Sea World helicopter crash, the sentencing of a man involved in a frenzied bus stabbing, and a major bakery blaze in Marrickville caused by a slice of pita bread. International reports cover the ongoing war in Ukraine and Israeli strikes on Beirut.   | Subscribe and ðŸ””: http://9Soci.al/KM6e50GjSK9 | Get more breaking news at 9News.com.au: http://9Soci.al/iyCO50GjSK6  CHAPTERS: 00:00 Introduction & Top Stories 00:40 Teenager Fatally Stabbed at Rouse Hill 01:44 Pauline Hanson's Burqa Stunt in Senate 03:40 Top Chinese Official in Canberra 04:24 SEAWORLD INQUEST: Harrowing Crash Footage 06:51 Inglenburn Bus Stabbing Sentencing 08:50 Marrickville Bakery Blaze 10:40 Lockdown over Toy Gun 12:41 Penrith Shooting Manhunt 13:14 Central Coast Drowning 14:45 Israel Strikes on Beirut 15:17 Ukraine Peace Talks & Russian Aggression 17:23 Sydney Forecast & NSW Heatwave 18:40 Jet Ski Tragedy Calls for Change 21:47 Renewed Search for Gus Lamont 22:04 New Housing Designs Unveiled 22:37 David Cameron's Prostate Cancer Diagnosis 23:16 Titanic Watch Auction Record 23:57 TikTok Renames ICC Sydney Venue  FOLLOW 9News Australia â–º Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/9News/ â–º Twitter: https://twitter.com/9NewsAUS â–º Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/9news/  Join 9News for the latest in news and events that affect you in your local city, as well as news from across Australia and the world.  #BREAKINGNEWS #9NEWS #AUSTRALIA

title: 9News Brisbane | Monday November 24 | Full Episode
description: Melissa Downs and Joel Dry lead the Queensland news, beginning with the widespread Storm Destruction Across South East Queensland, which left over 150,000 homes without power and caused extensive property damage, including giant hail. The Sea World Helicopter Crash Inquest opens, with harrowing new survivor testimony and compelling new evidence, including a key finding that neither pilot saw the other aircraft. In Federal Politics, Pauline Hanson's Burqa Stunt in the Senate causes chaos and a rare suspension of the upper house, and a major update in the Search for Missing 4-Year-Old Gus Lamont has police focusing on abandoned mine shafts.  Also, a major police operation in Beaumont Hills saw schools and residents locked down after reports of a man brandishing a rifle, which was later revealed to be a fake firearm found in the rubbish. title: 9News Melbourne | Monday November 24 | Full Episode
description: Alicia Loxley and Tom Steinfort present the Melbourne news, covering the Metro Tunnel safety crisis, as the Firefighters Union raises serious alarm bells about radio communication faults just before the new rail line is set to open. Also, the Sea World helicopter crash inquest begins, with a coroner showing shocking, never-before-seen footage from the doomed choppers, and a survivor recounts the terrifying final moments. Plus, Pauline Hanson sparks a furious debate in the Federal Senate after wearing a burqa, and an EastLink emergency sees major traffic delays after a serious car crash. title: 9News Adelaide | Monday November 24 | Full Episode
description: Brenton Ragless leads the Adelaide news, with a major update in the search for missing four-year-old Gus Lamont in South Australia's outback. It also covers the tragic death of a CFS firefighter on the Eyre Peninsula and the political fallout from Pauline Hanson's controversial burqa stunt in the Senate.
